purpose: A React component that provides a toggle group UI element using Radix UI primitives, allowing users to select one or multiple options from a group of toggle buttons

variables.name: ToggleGroupContext
variables.purpose: React Context to share variant and size props between ToggleGroup parent and ToggleGroupItem children
variables.usage: Provides default styling configuration that can be inherited by child items

variables.name: ToggleGroup
variables.purpose: The main container component for the toggle group
variables.usage: Wraps toggle items and provides context for shared styling

variables.name: ToggleGroupItem
variables.purpose: Individual toggle button within the group
variables.usage: Represents each selectable option in the toggle group

key_points: Built on top of Radix UI's toggle-group primitive for accessibility and behavior
Uses React Context to share variant and size props between parent and children
Implements forwardRef for proper ref forwarding
Reuses toggle button variants from a separate toggle component

patterns: Compound Component Pattern - using Context to share state between parent and children
forwardRef Pattern - allowing ref access to underlying DOM elements
Composition Pattern - building on top of Radix UI primitives
TypeScript type safety with proper type inference from primitives
issues: No default export which might be inconsistent with other UI components
Context default values might not match actual usage if toggleVariants has different defaults
No error boundary or fallback for missing context provider
The gap-1 class is hardcoded and not configurable through props
